abstract.p: RealNetworks, Internet music software publisher, releases RealAudio 8, upgrade to its underlying audio technology that company says will reduce amount of space users need to store sound files; new technology was developed in conjunction with Sony Corp (S)

block.p: RealNetworks, an Internet music software publisher, yesterday released RealAudio 8, an upgrade to its underlying audio technology that the company says will reduce the amount of space users need to store sound files. The new technology was developed in conjunction with Sony, which provided a format called Atrac3 that is being included in RealAudio 8. RealAudio converts music into audio files that can be downloaded, sent by e-mail or played on the Web. RealNetworks contends the new technology will allow users to store a CD-quality song using 2.5 megabytes of space on a hard drive, about half what it takes using some other technologies.
